content.description: A random sample of middle school students from District <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and a random sample of middle school students from District <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> were selected with an even number of students in each sample. The number of minutes each student spent playing a certain mobile game application in a typical day was recorded. The data are summarized in the following table.
content.question: <math alttext="Minimum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Min</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="Q 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Q1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="Median" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Med</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="Q 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Q3</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="Maximum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Max</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> District <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="112" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>112</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="120" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>120</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="130" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>130</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="137" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>137</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="145" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>145</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> District <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="112" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>112</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="128" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>128</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="130" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>130</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="145" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>145</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="152" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>152</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> If no two students within each district spent the same amount of time playing the mobile game application, which statement must be true?

choices.label: The number of students in the sample from District <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> was less than the number of students in the sample from District <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

The percentage of students in both samples who spent less than <math alttext="130" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>130</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes playing the game is equal.
No students in either district spent <math alttext="115" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>115</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes playing the game.

The range of the number of minutes spent playing the game was greater for the District <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> sample than for the District <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> sample.

The interquartile range of the number of minutes spent playing the game was less for the District <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> sample than for the District <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> sample.

content.answer: The percentage of students in both samples who spent less than <math alttext="130" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>130</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes playing the game is equal.

topic.text: 1.9: Comparing Distributions of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
